parameters.urbanpop: a numeric vector for the number of residents (per thousand) living in urban areas in 1970
parameters.incpc: a numeric vector for income per capita in 1973
parameters.state: a character vector for the state
parameters.region: a character vector for the Census region
parameters.pop: a numeric vector for residents (per thousand) under 18 years of age in 1974
parameters.edexppc: a numeric vector for per capita public school expenditures in a state, projected for 1975.

description:
Description
This is a simple data set provided by Chatterjee and Price (1977, p. 108)
that serves as a known example of heteroscedasticity.
title: Education Expenditure Data (Chatterjee and Price, 1977)
reference:
I copied these data from the robustbase package.
I just didn't want to make my students install it.
Note: I'm pretty sure "NB" was suppose to be "NE" and that
"DY" is supposed to be "KY". I made those changes.
format: A data frame with 50 observations on the following 6 variables.
